cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET. G.T. 5851
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 1st October, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the ST QUENTIN-CAMBRAI Front, we are reported to have taken JONCOURT, ESTREES, RUMILLY and high ground E. of it, BLECOURT and we are fighting for CUVILLERS.
On the YPRES Front the 2nd Army have reached LEBIZET, N. of ARMENTIERES and further north have captured ROLLEGHEMCAPELLE and LEDEGHEM.
French Front.
The enemy have been counter-attacking on the American front in the vicinity of APREMONT and have retaken EXERMONT and MONTREBEAU WOOD South of EXERMONT. West of RIEMS the french line between the VESLE and the AISNE runs CHALONS - TRIGNY - HERVELON - BOUVANCOURT - W. of CONCEVREUX.
2. MACEDONIAN, ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
Nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
1st October, 1918.
Issued at 6.35 p.m.
